column4: wifi expert? Help needed to connect computer to internet. Wifi does not connect to my access point..
what is the problem?
open up a terminal and type in 'iwconfig' then you'll see what interfaces are wireless
then you do a 'iwconfig ethX essid <wireless_network>
oh yeah, don't forget to execute dhclient :)
I already have "Strigen Access Pont" listed as ESSID when I run iwlist... I set it under the "Network" thing...
no, I have allowed the MAC adr... for the card of my compiters, but have turned of WEP & WPA...

this means "sudo dhclient ra0" on mine.. Looks like it is just waiting, and waiting :-( DHCP is turned on and everything, my 2 other computers are working, and the problem computer is working as well, but under Windows...
it replyes that no dhcp offers is received.
i have set the computer now to 192.168.132.209, i can not ping, the TX is increasing, but RX is still at 0 so it doesn't receive any..
gateway and dns is set to my server 192.168.132.20 as the other computers... but it can't get any web pages either
thats odd, are you sure that everything is set up correctly? can you reach one of your computers if you're just connecting with utp?

how do i do that (udp) ? The setup on the probnlem machine is the same as the one i'm using now, when i open "system,"->Administration->Network, I then have the same config on both... except that the one i'm using now has DHCP...
What about wich channel it is using? can that be wrong?
thats up to you to choose the correct channel could you post an 'ifconfig -a' and an 'iwlist scan' please?
OK, i'll get a memorystick to copy the content over :-)
Here is both the trouble computer, and my working one.. Look at the ESSID's at the scan ?!? http://pastebin.com/770895
your trouble desktop doesn't see the "Strigen Access Point" so that needs to be fixed, try setting your AP at channel 6 and try it again
can't i set the trouble computer to 12 insted? If i set that to 6, then i guess i have to reconf the 2 other computers? In both linux & windows :-)
yes indeed, but if you're desktop has trouble detecting your AP you have to try this
thanks a lot, I'll add this usefull things to my bugreport, wich i submitted som 3-4 months ago :-) Thanks again!
